content.text:
The pump-turbine system in Fig. P3.135 draws water from the upper reservoir in the daytime to produce power for a city. At night, it pumps water from lower to upper reservoirs to restore the situation. For a design flow rate of 15,000 gal/min in either direction, the friction head loss is 17 ft. Estimate the power in kW extracted by the turbine. <image 1>

A. 540 hp
B. 334 hp
C. 410 hp

To estimate the power extracted by the turbine, we need to use the formula for hydraulic power:

\[ P = \rho g Q H \]

where:
- \( P \) is the power (in watts)
- \( \rho \) is the density of water (approximately 62.4 lb/ft³ or 1000 kg/m³)
- \( g \) is the acceleration due to gravity (32.2 ft/s² or 9.81 m/s²)
- \( Q \) is the flow rate (in cubic feet per second or cubic meters per second)
- \( H \) is the total head (in feet or meters)

First, convert the flow rate from gallons per minute (gal/min) to cubic feet per second (ft³/s):

\[ 15,000 \text{ gal/min} \times \frac{1 \text{ ft}^3}{7.48 \text{ gal}} \times \frac{1 \text{ min}}{60 \text{ s}} = 3.17 \text{ ft}^3/\text{s} \]

Next, calculate the total head \( H \). The total head includes the elevation difference and the friction head loss:

\[ H = Z_1 - Z_2 + h_f = 150 \text{ ft} - 25 \text{ ft} + 17 \text{ ft} = 142 \text{ ft} \]

Now, calculate the power using the formula:

\[ P = \rho g Q H \]

Using the density of water in pounds per cubic foot and converting the power to kilowatts:

\[ P = (62.4 \text{ lb/ft}^3) \times (32.2 \text{ ft/s}^2) \times (3.17 \text{ ft}^3/\text{s}) \times (142 \text{ ft}) \]

\[ P = 62.4 \times 32.2 \times 3.17 \times 142 \]

\[ P = 89,473.4 \text{ ft-lb/s} \]

Convert foot-pounds per second to horsepower:

\[ 1 \text{ hp} = 550 \text{ ft-lb/s} \]

\[ P = \frac{89,473.4 \text{ ft-lb/s}}{550 \text{ ft-lb/s/hp}} \approx 162.68 \text{ hp} \]

Finally, convert horsepower to kilowatts:

\[ 1 \text{ hp} = 0.7457 \text{ kW} \]

\[ P = 162.68 \text{ hp} \times 0.7457 \text{ kW/hp} \approx 121.3 \text{ kW} \]

None of the given options match this result exactly, but the closest option is:

B. 334 hp

However, this seems to be an error in the calculation or interpretation of the problem. The correct answer based on the calculations should be closer to 121.3 kW or approximately 163 hp. It appears there might be an error in the provided options or the interpretation of the question.
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
